info.title: A guide to XPO's REST APIs
info.description:
# Introduction 
Welcome to XPO's API reference page! 

Our modern REST APIs enable partners to leverage the vast XPO transportation and supply chain expertise and technology capabilities.  XPO APIs bring everything you love about our business directly into your ERP or TMS system. 
- **How we drive customer success:** 
 * Allow our customers to retrieve real-time quotes, and if desired, turn those quotes into orders. 
 * Customers can submit, update, and delete orders. 
 * Provide our customers with real-time order and shipment tracking events. 
 * Allow customers to retrieve summary and detail invoice data while also providing the physical invoice document.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: XPO Logistics uses OAuth 2.0 client credentials to secure access to the API endpoints. The Client Credentials grant type can be used by clients to obtain an access token outside of the context of a user. Request for a bearer token using the oAuth client credentials and x-api-key provided by XPO.

post.description: Allows partner to retrieve their own auth token.

x-code-samples.source:
curl -X POST \ 
 https://api-np-connect.xpo.com/OAuthService/rest/v1/token \ 
 -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ 
 -d '{ 
 "client_id": "Your Client ID", 
 "client_secret": "Your Client Secret", 
 "audience": "https://inavisphere.chrobinson.com", 
 "grant_type": "client_credentials" 
 }'

500.description: Internal Server Error. Please contact you XPO rep.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Please contact your XPO rep.

description.description: Customer supplied description of the item.

Selected promise date.

* `promisedShipDate` - Identifies the pick up date as promised to customer. 
* `promisedDeliveryDate` - Identifies the delivery date as promised to customer.

suggestedScac.description: Indicates a specific carrier SCAC customer wishes to associate to the order.

suggestedCarrierPartyCode.description: XPO identifier for a carrier customer wishes to associate to the order.

referenceNumbers.description: Additional reference number objects pertaining to this service.

orderLocation.description: Indicates the locations assigned to this service. All service objects only have two location objects. If you have multiple stops, they need to broken into single pick, single drop pairs, each under its own service object.

customerLocationId.description:
Customer defined identifier associated to a specific location. 

### If XPO maintains a list of the customer's location IDs, then customerLocationId can be provided in lieu of address information.

name.description:
Name of the location. If the address of the location is not in XPO's system, it is mandatory to include the `name` parameter so
  XPO can auto-create the location in our system on order create.

openDateTime.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time of the earliest time carrier can arrive at the stop.

closeDateTime.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time of the latest time carrier can arrive at the stop.

arrivalDate.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time that carrier has arrived. ### Would only ever be sent on an order update if customer received the information instead of XPO.

departureDate.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time that carrier has departed. ### Would only ever be sent on an order update if customer received the information instead of XPO.

scheduledOpenDateTime.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time when location is scheduled to be open.

scheduledCloseDateTime.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time when location is scheduled to be closed.

readyAvailableDateTime.description: ISO8601 UTC date-time when location is ready to receive the shipment. ### Would only be sent if the location type is destination.

rsDateTime.description: An ISO8601 UTC date-time when location is ready for shipment to be picked up. ### Would only be sent if the location type is origin.

scalesRequired.description: Indicates if order requires weighing at this location.

hasDropTrailer.description: Indicates if this location is drop trailer.

specialInstructions.description: Customer defined instructions for this location.

orderAddress.description: Object that contains address specific information.

address2.description: Indicate address line two of the location.

address4.description: Indicate address line four of the location.

county.description: Indicate the county of the location.

long.description: Indicate the longitude of the location

postalCode.description: Indicate the postal code of the location, sometime refered to as the zip code.

blindLocation.description: A "blind shipment" is a shipment, regardless of mode, in which the party paying the freight charges requests that either the actual "shipper" or actual "consignee" not be disclosed on the bill of lading or other shipping documentation in order to shield such party's identity from another party.

liftGate.description: Indicates that a lift gate is needed.

insidePickup.description: Indicates that inside pickup is needed. **Only used on the origin/pick stop**

insideDelivery.description: Indicates that inside delivery is needed. **Only used on the destination/drop stop**

residentialNonCommercial.description: Indicates that a stop is residential non-commercial.

limitedAccess.description: Indicates that stop has limited access.

tradeShoworConvention.description: Indicates that stop is a trade show or convention.

constructionSite.description: Indicates that stop is a construction site.

dropOffAtCarrierTerminal.description: Indicates that customer will drop off at carrier terminal. **Only used on the origin/pick stop**

pickupAtCarrierTerminal.description: Indicates that customer will pickup at carrier terminal. **Only used on the destination/drop stop**

sortAndSegregate.description: Indicates that items will need to be sorted at stop. **Only used on the destination/drop stop**

packageCodeRatingEnum.description: XPO defined code for packaging type/code. Here is a list of the most commonly used packagingCodes: `BAL` - Bale, `BAG` - Bags, `BIN` - Bin, `BOX` - Boxes, `CTN` - Cartons `CAS` - Case, `CRT` - Crates, `PKG` - Package, `EAC` - Eaches, `PLT` - Pallet, `PCS` - Pieces For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here. ### Required if quote will be used to create an Order.

packageCodeEnum.description: XPO defined code for packaging type/code. Here is a list of the most commonly used packagingCodes: `BAL` - Bale, `BAG` - Bags, `BIN` - Bin, `BOX` - Boxes, `CTN` - Cartons `CAS` - Case, `CRT` - Crates, `PKG` - Package, `EAC` - Eaches, `PLT` - Pallet, `PCS` - Pieces For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

parcelPackageCodeEnum.description: Used to specify if carrier-specific branded packaging is used for a parcel shipment. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

contactTypeEnum.description:
Indicates the type of contact specified:
  * `Vendor` - Vendor party (Non Transportation Supplier)
  * `Buyer` - Buyer Party
  * `Contact` - Contact Party
  * `OrderedBy` - Ordered By Party on the Order or Load
  * `NotifyParty` - Notify Party
  * `OnlineContact` - CHRWOnline Contact
  * `SchedWith` - Scheduled With
  * `POCustomer` - Customer on the Purchase Order

contactPositionEnum.description: Indicates the type of contact. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here. ###

contactMethodEnum.description: Indicates the best method for reaching the specified contact.

weightUomEnum.description: Unit of measure for weight parameters.

volumeUomEnum.description: Unit of measure for volume parameters.

linearUomEnum.description: Unit of measure for height, width, and length parameters.

temperatureUomEnum.description: Unit of measure for temperature parameters.

temperatureSensitiveEnum.description:
Indicates if temperature control is needed, and what level:
  * `Dry` - Dry
  * `Fresh` - Fresh (25 to 32 degrees)
  * `Frozen` - Frozen (-10 to 0 degrees)
  * `Chilled` - Chilled (40 to 60 degrees)
  * `DeepFrozen` - Deep Frozen (-20 to -20 degrees)
  * `Refrigerated` - Refrigerated (33 to 39 degrees)
  * `Protect` - Protect (33 to 60 degrees)
  * `Custom` - Custom
  * `Produce` - Produce
  * `Mixed` - Mixed
  * `Empty` - Empty

distanceUomEnum.description: Unit of measure for distance parameters.

stateProvinceCodeEnum.description: Indicate the state or province of the location. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

countryCodeEnum.description: Indicate the country of the location. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

countryCodeRatingEnum.description: Indicate the country of the location. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here. ### Required if quote will be used to create an Order.

type.description: XPO defined code for reference number types. Here is a list of the most commonly used reference number types: `SHID` - Shipment ID #, `MBOL` - Master Bill of Lading #, `PO` - Purchase Order #, `BOL` - Bill of Lading #, `CRID` - Customer Specific Ref Number, `CUSTPO` - Customer PO Number, `DEL` - Delivery #, `JNO` - Job Number, `PU` - Pickup #, `CON` - Customer Order Number, `APPT` - Appointment Number For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

value.description: The actual value of the reference number.

liftGate.description: Indicates that a lift gate is needed.

insidePickup.description: Indicates that inside pickup is needed. **Only used on the origin/pick stop**

insideDelivery.description: Indicates that inside delivery is needed. **Only used on the destination/drop stop**

residentialNonCommercial.description: Indicates that a stop is residential non-commercial.

limitedAccess.description: Indicates that stop has limited access.

tradeShoworConvention.description: Indicates that stop is a trade show or convention.

constructionSite.description: Indicates that stop is a construction site.

dropOffAtCarrierTerminal.description: Indicates that customer will drop off at carrier terminal. **Only used on the origin/pick stop**

pickupAtCarrierTerminal.description: Indicates that customer will pickup at carrier terminal. **Only used on the destination/drop stop**

rateCodeEnum.description: XPO defined code for rating code. Here is a list of the most commonly used rate codes: `400` - Line Haul, `405` - Fuel Surchage, `260` - Deliver Surchage, `IDL` - Inside Delivery, `IPU` - Inside Pickup `LFT` - Lift Gate or Forklift Service, `DET` - Detention, `DLA` - Delivery Limited Access, `PLA` - Pickup Limited Access `RES` - Residential Delivery Fee, `REP` - Residential Pickup Fee, `CSD` - Construction Site Delivery here.

currencyCodeEnum.description: Code to indicate the currency being used. The most common currently in use with XPO: * `USD` - US Dollar * `CAD` - Canadian Dollar * `MXN` - Mexican Peso * `EUR` - European Euro For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

lateCodeEnum.description: XPO defined code for a carrier being late to a stop or reason to schedule new appiontment. Here is a list of the most commonly used late reason codes: * `1` - Missed Delivery - Transportation carrier missed customer delivery * `3` - Returned to Shipper * `9` - Mechanical breakdown * `14` - Weather or Natural Disaster Related - Shipment delayed by natural disaster or severe weather For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

tarpTypeEnum.description:
Details the type of tarp required for flat bed trailer.
  * `10` - Ten Feet
  * `2` - Two Feet
  * `4` - Four Feet
  * `6` - Six Feet
  * `8` - Eight Feet
  * `MESH` - Nursery/Mesh
  * `NO TARP` - No Tarp Required
  * `SMOKE` - Smoke Tarp
  * `TOP` - Top

loadingTypeEnum.description:
Describes how trailer will need to be loaded.
  * `CRANE` - Top/crane
  * `REAR` - Rear
  * `SIDE` - Side
  * `REAR/SIDE` - Rear/side
  * `TOP/SIDE` - Top/side

itemEquipmentTypeEnum.description: Indicates the equipment type needed to move the item. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

serviceLevelEnum.description: XPO defined code for a service offering. For a detailed description of all enumerated codes please find them here.

hazardousGroupEnum.description:
Dangerous goods are assigned into 3 packing groups (also known as UN Packing Group) in accordance with the degree of danger they present.
  * `I` - Group I - Major Danger
  * `II` - Group II - Medium Danger
  * `III` - Group III - Minor Danger

hazmatCodeEnum.description:
Defines the authorizing entity:

  * `D` - HazMat US Regulatory Authority Codes
  * `I` - HazMat MX/International Regulatory Authority Codes

transportModeEnum.description:
Defines the mode:
  * `LTL` - Less Than Truckload
  * `TL` - Truckload
  * `Air` - Air
  * `Ocean` - Ocean
  * `Bulk` - Bulk
  * `Consol` - Consolidated
  * `Flatbed` - Flatbed

sellModeEnum.description:

  * `DomesticAir` - Domestic Air Transportation
  * `Ocean` - Ocean Transportation
  * `IMDL` - Intermodal Full Container Transportation

  * `TLFlatbed` - Truckload Flatbed Transportation
  * `SmallParcel` - Small Parcel Transportation
  * `Tautliner` - Tatliner Transportation

freightClassEnum.description: Indicates the freight class on this shipment. (Freight Class is a voluntary standard that provides a comparison of commodities moving in interstate, intrastate and foreign commerce. It is similar in concept to the groupings or grading systems that serve many other industries.)

incoTermsEnum.description:
The Incoterms or International Commercial Terms are a series of pre-defined commercial terms published by the International Chamber of Commerce (ICC) relating to international commercial law.
  * `DAT` - Delivered at Terminal
  * `DAP` - Delivered at Place
  * `CIF` - Cost Insurance & Freight
  * `CPT` - Carriage Paid To
  * `CIP` - Carriage & Insurance Paid To
